name: Test 1
description: This sketch explores the relationship between mathematical algorithms and visual form. Using a series of loops and coordinate mapping

name: Art 1
description: This sketch uses a grid system where every shape is built from randomized vertices. By skipping some layers and randomizing the stroke colors, I turned a standard grid into a messy, energetic texture.

name: art style 1 version 2
description: A mix of structured geometry and organic randomness. I used a dark background and a star-generation loop to set the scene, then layered thin, vibrating teal lines on top to create a sense of depth and movement

name: art style 2 version 1
description: This piece explores layers and movement. I used a custom gradient for the sky and a loop to generate a starfield, while the waves at the bottom use shifting noise values to create a smooth, liquid motion that never repeats exactly the same way twice.

name: art style 2 version 2
description: This sketch explores interactive data visualization. By combining a 2D noise field with a glow effect (layered ellipses), I created a dynamic grid where the user controls the intensity of the visual weight by moving their mouse.

name: art 3.1
description: This piece visualizes an invisible field of energy. I used 2,000 individual particles that follow a 'flow field' driven by Perlin noise. As they move, they leave behind delicate, colorful trails that slowly reveal the hidden mathematical patterns of the 'wind' blowing across the canvas.

name: art 3.2
description: A high energy version of a flow field. By using 3,000 particles and a fading background, I created a 'ghost trail' effect. The particles move with much more turbulence than before, swirling like colorful smoke or deep sea currents that constantly shift and disappear.

name: art 3.2 with sound
description: I combined generative art with sound synthesis. The particles follow a complex noise field, and their movement triggers random notes from a pentatonic scale
